title: Fauci apologises for saying UK 'rushed' vaccine
description: After apparent criticism from the US expert, the UK defended the safety and efficacy of the vaccine.

title: Puerto Rico: The moment the Arecibo Observatory telescope collapsed
description: Video shows one of the world's largest telescopes at Puerto Rico's Arecibo Observatory crashing down.

title: Covid-19 vaccine: Who will get the Pfizer vaccine first?
description: As the UK becomes the first country in the world to approve mass use of a Covid vaccine for over-16s, the BBC's Laura Foster explains which high-risk groups will receive it first.

title: Is Africa overtaking the Middle East as the new jihadist battleground?
description: As 300 UK troops arrive in Mali, the BBC's Frank Gardner looks at the role of Islamist militants across Africa.

title: Jonathan Van-Tam's best analogies: Penalties, equalisers & yoghurts
description: The deputy chief medical officer's colourful metaphors have made him a household name.

title: Premier League and EFL agree rescue package amounting to £250m
description: The Premier League and EFL agree a rescue package amounting to £250m to help ease the financial challenge faced by EFL clubs as a result of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Avonmouth warehouse explosion: Emergency services at scene
description: Firefighters were called to an explosion at warehouse in an industrial area near Bristol.

title: Covid-19 vaccine: First jabs 'could cut 99% of deaths' - Jonathan Van-Tam
description: It is key to deploy the vaccine "as fast" as possible, England's deputy chief medical officer says.

title: Wrexham woman died after being strangled by dog leads
description: Deborah Roberts was strangled by her pet dogs' leads as she walked them, an inquest hears.

title: Top teacher wins $1m and gives half away
description: An Indian village school teacher wins the Global Teacher Prize and shares the award with runners-up.

title: Brexit: UK-EU trade talks down to the wire
description: The UK and EU teams are under pressure to finalise an agreement, as talks continue in London.

title: Topshop owner Arcadia limits gift cards to 50% of purchase
description: People with vouchers will only be able to use them for half of their order, the company says.

title: Ken Maginnis: Peer faces 18-month ban over bullying claims
description: Lord Maginnis was accused of using homophobic language in dealings with parliamentary colleagues.

title: Coronavirus: US hits record Covid cases and hospitalisations
description: Two records are reached on Wednesday, amid fears the pace will not slow leading up to Christmas.

title: GCSEs and A-levels: Extra measures 'to ensure fair exams next summer'
description: There will be more generous grading in next year's GCSEs and A-levels in England to help those age groups.

title: Classic Premier League: West Ham beat Manchester United in Boleyn Ground farewell
description: Watch highlights of the dramatic Premier League encounter from 2016 between West Ham United and Manchester United in the Hammers' final game at the Boleyn Ground.

title: Mad Max star Hugh Keays-Byrne dies aged 73
description: Tributes have been paid to the actor, who played the villain Toecutter opposite Mel Gibson.

title: Bairstow set for England Test recall after pulling out of Big Bash
description: Batsman Jonny Bairstow is set to return to the England Test squad for January's proposed tour of Sri Lanka after withdrawing from the Big Bash League.

title: Champion jockey Murphy 'saw cocaine' night before test
description: Champion flat jockey Oisin Murphy admits he saw "cocaine was present" the night before he tested positive for the drug in July.

title: Advent calendar: Day three - Stephen Maguire hits 'most amazing shot in history of snooker'
description: Day three of BBC Sport's 2020 advent calendar looks back on Stephen Maguire's double fluke against Neil Robertson at the Masters.

title: European Super League: Poll finds younger fans happier about prospect of breakaway league
description: A BBC poll shows younger fans are happier about the prospect of a European Super League than older fans.

title: Ethiopia's Tigray crisis: 'How the conflict made my uncle a refugee in Sudan'
description: A BBC reporter's relative fled to neighbouring Sudan by foot and boat, losing his shoes on the way.

title: 'Covid ended our marriage': The couples who split in the pandemic
description: Around the world, previously happy couples are splitting up and divorcing due to the stress of the pandemic.

title: Tracey Emin on bladder cancer: 'Art kept me alive'
description: One of Britain's most celebrated artists tells the BBC how her new exhibition helped her get through cancer treatment.

title: Toilets: Men’s, Women’s or Gender-Neutral?
description: The government says its review will help “ensure there is a diversity of provision and facilities for everyone.”

title: 'We've just moved to a remote island we'd never visited'
description: Alex and Buffy dropped everything to start a new life on the Isle of Rum, which they had only seen in pictures.

title: South Korea: The life-changing exam that won't stop for a pandemic
description: Despite a third wave, nearly 500,000 South Koreans will sit for critical university entrance tests.

title: 'Direct debit fraud cost my mum £1,000'
description: Phil Lind says his mother, Ursula, had money stolen from her bank account after criminals beat security.

title: Will Santa have enough bikes for Christmas Day?
description: Millions of bicycles were sold this year, with fears there won't be enough for the festive period.
